In the problem description I mentioned the large number of warning messages.
Most of the warning messages were because I checked out ..ui.diseasemodels.editor which I suppose is an obsolete project (or at least not one that I have checked in on Windows.

There are only 2 remaining warning messages.  These relate to plugin.xml and plugin.properties in the geography project which appear to be generated.
Strange but I guess nothing to be worried about.  

Severity and Description	Path	Resource	Location	Creation Time	Id
The file "plugin.properties" does not exist in the workspace	org.eclipse.ohf.stem.geography	build.properties	line 6	1172626341044	5739
The file "plugin.xml" does not exist in the workspace	org.eclipse.ohf.stem.geography	build.properties	line 5	1172626341043	5738

Problems were due to the product.stem file not having been updated for Linux (obvious in retrospect) 
Also Linux requires the splash screen to be in XPM format.

With those changes, STEM appears to run on Linux.  I didn't test everything completely since I am running remotely and cannot run the GoogleEarth on a remote display.  But I can start a simulation and the internal map shows the disease spread.  

I have checked in a splash.xpm and stemLinux.product file.

The initial test STEM based on using stemLinux.product is successful
stemLinux has been checked into the ui project.
We should also generate a STEM standalone RCP and test it.
